column4: can someone please help me get my machine using wifi? ubuntu is not being nice!
go to terminal and run lspci
find wireless card and youll see the make/model
I have a laptop here with an atheros card that is doing the same thing. WPA on, doesnt work. WPA off, works fine
delete that SSID from your wifi on the laptop and redo it. one time I did that and it magically worked.
not sure if it will but worth it to try
it's likely because you have different wireless cards.
you have to understand, not every company has the same level of support for linux
so how do i fix that?
intel and atheros have great support. realtek, not bad. broadcom, absolutely horrible.
I personally just get wifi cards made by intel and throw them in my systems that are having issues, lol.
I hate broadcom with a passion. but ironically I'm trying to get one to work at the moment.
also, what did lspci return for wireless? what card do you have?
read up in the chat. i posted it.
